  Text content: Dear Members of the Harvard Community,

For over 75 years, the federal government has funded Harvard and other universities, enabling medical, engineering, and scientific breakthroughs that have improved lives worldwide. Recently, the government threatened to end partnerships with some universities, including Harvard, due to accusations of antisemitism on campuses. These partnerships have been highly productive. As we face new possibilities like treatments for Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, diabetes, and advances in AI and quantum science, losing government support now could harm millions' health and our nation's economic future.

edit target content:
Dear Members of the Harvard Community,

For over 75 years, the federal government has funded Harvard and other universities, enabling medical, engineering, and scientific breakthroughs that have improved lives worldwide. Recently, the government threatened to end partnerships with some universities, including Harvard, due to accusations of antisemitism on campuses. These partnerships have been highly productive. As we face new possibilities like treatments for Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, diabetes, and advances in AI and quantum science, losing government support now could harm millions' health and our nation's economic future.
content after edit:
Dear Harvard Community,

For more than 75 years, the federal government has supported Harvard and other universities, helping create important medical and scientific advances that benefit people everywhere. Recently, the government has considered stopping this support for some schools, including Harvard, because of antisemitism concerns on campuses. These partnerships have led to great progress. Losing this support now could hurt health research and our country’s economy, especially as we develop new treatments and technologies in areas like Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, diabetes, AI, and quantum science.

edit target content:
Dear Members of the Harvard Community,

For over 75 years, the federal government has funded Harvard and other universities, enabling medical, engineering, and scientific breakthroughs that have improved lives worldwide. Recently, the government threatened to end partnerships with some universities, including Harvard, due to accusations of antisemitism on campuses. These partnerships have been highly productive. As we face new possibilities like treatments for Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, diabetes, and advances in AI and quantum science, losing government support now could harm millions' health and our nation's economic future.
content after edit:
Dear Harvard Community,

For more than 75 years, the federal government has supported Harvard and other universities, helping create important medical and scientific advances that benefit people everywhere. Recently, the government has considered stopping this support for some schools, including Harvard, because of antisemitism concerns on campuses. These partnerships have led to great progress. Losing this support now could hurt health research and our country’s economy, especially as we develop new treatments and technologies in areas like Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, diabetes, AI, and quantum science.
